info.title: DoctorTesting.v1
info.description: The Denefits API is organized around REST. Our API has predictable resource-oriented URLs which returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs. You can use the Denefits API in test mode, which does not affect your live data or interact with the banking networks. The token you use to authenticate the request determines whether the request is live mode or test mode.

post.description:
We need this API to upload a file which results in a file_id. This file_id is required while adding the bank account of a provider in Add Provider’s bank account API keys - “front_file” and “back_file”. For each different file_id would be required. Similary we require file_id in claims APIs - Submit claim form and Upload extra documents to claim contract.

    Choose the file to upload and enter the purpose. The possible values for purpose are –   
  
    ●  bank_document – Upload file related to the bank.          
    ●  denefits_file – Upload file related to Denefits.          
    ●  claim_document – Upload the file related to claims.

file.description: Choose file you want to upload

get.description:
Get a list of the payouts already paid to the provider using this API. 

This API returns payout_id also that would be required in the Provider Payout details API.

In Provider Payout list API we got the list of payouts but if we want to see the details of a particular payout then we will use this API. The response of this API will give us the details on whether the payout is from the contract or Payment Process or Accounts Receivable. 

We will get the payout_id from the Provider payout list API to see the details of that particular payout paid to the provider.
In this API we will get the report of all the contracts which are made so far.
In this API we will get the report of all the payouts which are already paid to the provider whether it is from the Contract or Payment Processor or Accounts Receivable.
This API gives us the list of payments which will be done in near future.

In this API we gets the details of the payment already done. 

We need to provide the payment_id which we can get from the List of payments of a provider API.

In the response we will get payment_receipt link to download the receipt.

get.summary: List of Payments of a provider
get.description:
In this API we could get the details of the payment already done. 

There are 2 filters - search and payment_status

payment_status could be one of the following values-

    pending - payment is requested from the customer but it is still in pending state.
    successful - payment is done from the customer end.
    failed - attempt was made to pay but due to some reason payment failed.
    reversed - payment was done by the customer but due to some reason payment was reversed/returned.

In the response we have payment_receipt, it is the link to download the receipt.

parameters.name: search_string
parameters.description: Search by payment ID, name, email or phone number

post.description:
This API is used to process a payment for the service taken by the customer.

We can get the card_token from the Card Integration API respectively.

In response we will get a payment_id for the payment done.

value.message: This provider doesn't have a bank account linked with their account.
Finance amount (Service amount - downpayment) must be between $300 and $20000

get.description:
To create a contract we need to start with this API. It will list all the possible plans and we can select the one from it. but if month was defined then we will get the plan for that particular month. 

We will get plan_id(s) in response which will be required in Select a plan API.

parameters.name: filter_month
parameters.description: Return plan for this specific month.

get.description: Returns provider's bank details. If provider's bank is already added then this API will show the details of the bank otherwise it will show a message that no bank is added for this provider.

value.message: This provider already have a bank account linked with their account.

post.description:
For a newly created provider we need to add a bank account details to get access to other payment related APIs.
 We require a bank_token which we will get from Create bank token API. 

Based on the account type we selected in Create bank token API, we have to define the parameters in this API.

  In case provider's account type is "individual" then we have to define following additional parameters- 

    ●  ssn_number - mandatory.          
    ●  date_of_birth – mandatory.          
    ●  front_file – optional.
    ●  back_file – optional but mandatory if front_file is defined.    
    
  In case provider's account type is "company" then we have to define following parameter- 

    ●  business_tax_id - mandatory.

In this API we will be selecting the plan and providing the customer’s details.

We will use the plan_id which we got from the response of the List of plan API.
start_date will be the date from when we want the contract to start (first recurring amount payment date).
service_array is the breakdown of the services taken by the customer and it is optional.

In the response we will get the finance_token which will be used in Pay for Contract API.

service_array.description: This is an array which requires the details of the service provided with the price. This field will be required after 1st July 2020.

post.description:
We will be making the payment for the contract using this API. For this we need finance_token and card_token. finance_token we got from Select a Plan API and for card_token we have to go to Card Integration API and in that API’s response we will get card_token.

In response we will get the contract_id and contract_code. contract_id will be used in Contract details API.

payments.payment_type: Denefits Fee + Down Payment + Upfront Payment

customer.customer_address: 189 Beaver Ridge Ave. test address, Schenectady, NY, 12345

get.description:
We can get the details of the contract along with the payments with share to the partner and provider from this API.

We need to provide the contract_id if we have the contract id for that provider then we will use that otherwise we can get the contracts list from the List of contracts of a provider API.

get.summary: List of contracts of a provider
get.description: We will get the list of all the contracts which were created by the provider.

To add a bank account for a provider we have to create a bank token which in return will give us a bank_token which will be required in the Add Provider's bank account API

Now there would be 2 types of accounts – Individual and Company. If we are adding bank details for Individual then we have to select individual from dropdown list next to account_type and in case we are adding bank details for Company then we have to select company.

    For testing purpose we can use following details-

    account_number: 000123456789
    rounting_number: 110000000

value.message: "new_payment_date" must be less than or equal to "3_months_after_date"
"new_payment_date" must be larger than or equal to "tommorow_date"

parameters.name: new_recurring_date
parameters.description: Choose date upto 3 months from tomorrow, format - YYYY-MM-DD

get.description:
When a provider financed a customer and a contract is created then we have an option to change the recurring date. We will get the amount for changing the date using this API. In case the contract was in overdue state then late fees would also be included in the total amount. 

We need a contract_id which we can get from List of contracts API. We can select the new_recurring_date upto 90 from tomorrow.

We will get change_date_token in response which we will require in the Change recurring date of contract API.

post.description:
As we are working on changing the recurring date this is the next API which will actually change the recurring date. In the previous API we got the amount for changing the recurring date.

We will use the same contract_id which we used in Get recurring date change amount API and from the response of this API we will get the change_date_token.

If there is some amount which we have to pay for the change in contract’s recurring date then define the payment_from. payment_from could be from one of the below mentioned values-

    1 - means that the customer is going to pay it using his/her card.
    2 - means that provider is going to pay using his/her card for the change in recurring date.
    3 - means that provider is going to pay using his/her provider’s Denefits account. In this case we need not to define the card_token.

card_token we can get from the Card Integration API.
    
In case there is no amount to pay for changing the recurring date then we need not to define the payment_from and card_token.

We can verify that the recuring date is changed for the contract in Contract details API response next_recurring_date for this contract.

payment_from.description: 1-Customer's new card, 2-Provider's new card, 3-provider's denefits account

post.description:
Due to many reasons we need to cancel the contract which could be done using this API. A fixed $30 will be charged to cancel a contract.

We need to provide the contract_id we will get from the List of contracts of a provider API.

payment_from could be from one of the below mentioned values-

    1 - means that the customer is going to pay it using his/her card.
    2 - means that provider is going to pay using his/her card for the change in recurring date.
    3 - means that provider is going to pay using his/her provider’s Denefits account. Also in this case we need not to mention the card_token.
    
card_token we can get from the the Card Integration API.

In case there is no amount to pay for changing the recurring date then we need not to define the payment_from and card_token.

We can verify this in Contract details API response contract_status for the contract.

card_token.description: required if payment from new card

get.summary: List of available claims of a provider

value.message: Your industry doesn't allow insured payments

get.description:
This API will show the list of contracts which could be claimed.

In response we will get a list of available contract(s) which could be claimed by the provider. And number_of_payments_to_claim shows how many payments could be claimed under a particular contract_id.

get.summary: List of missing payments of the contract

list.reason: This payment cannot be claimed as this payment will be held by Denefits and paid at the end of contract.
You can only claim a payment after 03-31-2020 and before 05-30-2020
You can only claim a payment after 07-01-2020

value.message: Your industry doesn't allow insured payments

get.description:
In this API we will get the list of missing payments of the contract by using contract_id which we can get from the List of available claims of the provider API response.

In response we will get –

    missing_payment_id – it is the id of the missing payment.
    can_be_claimed – it will tell us whether we can claim this payment or not. If its value is 1   then we can claim this payment now.
    reason – it is a reason when or why we cannot claim this payment.
    recurring_date – date on which payment was to be made but customer didn’t do it.
    note – notes added by the Admin.
    
missing_payment_id will be used in the Claim a payment API.

list.document_type_name: Proof of treatment completed like before & after pictures, X-rays, clinical notes, treatment charts.
A complete itemized breakdown of services provided.

value.message: You have already submitted claim form for this contract.
Your industry doesn't allow insured payments

get.description:
If a provider hasn't claimed any contract then we need to first submit the claim form before claiming the payment. To submit a claim we need to know what all documents are required to upload. This API will give us the list of documents required.

Provide the contract_id for which missing payments are available in List of missing payment of the contract API.

In response we will get the list of documents which are required to be uploaded in the Submit claim form API. We will get the following values in response -

    document_type – it is the number/id of the document.
    
    document_type_name – it is the name of the file which is to be uploaded.
    
    required – it will tell us whether this document is necessary to be uploaded or not. 1 means it’s mandatory and 0 means it’s not mandatory.

document_type is required in the Submit claim form API.

value.message: File ID file_34523653443*********** is not present at the server
You have already submitted claim form for this contract.
Your industry doesn't allow insured payments
Your BSA form is under process.

post.description:
To claim a payments of a contract we need to submit this form. It is to be filled once for a contract. If the provider is linked with the healthcare industry then he has to first fill the HSA form under HSA/BSA form API. And if the provider is linked with the non-healthcare industry then the provider cannot claim a payment as it is not insured payment but he has to fill BSA form. So only providers linked with the healthcare industry could claim the payments.

From the response of List of missing payment of the contract API we gets the contract_id.
is_service_completed is either 0(means complete service was not given to the customer) or 
1(means complete service was given to the customer).

document_array values-

    document_type - we can get from the response of Required Documents API.
    
    file_id – we can get the file id from Upload file API. In that API we have to define the purpose as “claim_document”.

is_service_completed.description: Accepts 0, 1 (0- if service is not completed yet, 1- if service is completed)

value.message: Your industry doesn't allow insured payments

post.description:
Once the claim form is submitted then only we can claim the payment. We can only claim the missing payments for which can_be_claimed is 1 in List of missing payment of the contract API. After a claim request is submitted then we need to wait for the Admin to approve it or if some document(s) is required for the same.

contract_id which we used in the List of missing payment of the contract API and in the response of this API we will get the missing_payment_id whose can_be_claimed=1 we can use.

Once the payment is claimed we need to wait until it gets approved. We can get the current status of the payment claimed from the Contract claim details API.

get.summary: List of all claims of a provider

value.message: Your industry doesn't allow insured payments

get.description:
This API will show the list of contract claims that are already submitted or are paid.

In the response we will get the claim_id which we will be used in Contract claim details API.

value.message: Your industry doesn't allow insured payments

get.description:
Once the available missing payment's claim has been submitted then we can check the status of the claim in this API. It will give us the information on the contract, payment claims and documents uploaded.

claim_id which we can get from the List of all claims of a provider API response.

In response we will get the following –

    claim_uploaded_documents - list of documents we uploaded in Submit claim form API.
    
    missing_payments -  missing payments which were shown in the List of missing payments of the contract API. We can check the claim_status_id which will give us the information that whether the documentation needed, documents uploaded, denied, expired, processing or paid.
    
    contract_details – it gives us information about the contract.
    
    more_document_needed - we will get the list of documents which are further required to approve the claim. It contains more_dcument_id(id), date_added(when it was requested), document_type_name(name of the document required) and reason(why this document is required). 

more_document_id will be required in Need More Documents and Upload extra documents to claim contract APIs.

value.message: Your industry doesn't allow insured payments

get.description:
If documents uploaded by the provider for claim are incomplete or require more documents then it could be seen in this API. It will list the contract whose more documentation is required.

In response we will get the list of contracts and number_of_documents_required will give us the number of documents required to be uploaded against a contract claim.

post.summary: Upload extra documents to claim contract

value.message: Your industry doesn't allow insured payments

post.description:
This API will be used to Upload more documents which are required to approve the claim.

Under document_array define the more_document_id which we got from the response of Contract claim details API. 
file_id we can get from the Upload file API (while uploading keeping the purpose “claim_document”). We can upload more than one document at a time.

Verify the status of of the claim from Contract claim details API and check the claim_status_id under missing_payments in the response.

requestBody.description: more_document_id can be obtained from claim/detail API which provide the info is more documents is required or not.

post.description: Get 3D secure payment client ID to make payment

get.description: Provider can get the profile details by using this API. We will get the provider's and its business information and whether payment is enabled or not and based on it provider can move forward to payment related APIs.

This API is used to search globally among all Contracts and Payments.

Based on the search_string and search_type response will be displayed. In case search_type is 1 then search will be on Contracts otherwise on Payments.

post.summary: Provide customer details for the Payment/Contract

total.description: Total payable amount every month (Without Late Fees)

full_amount_disabled_reason.description: Reason for which Payment Processor has been disabled.

plan_disabled_reason.description: Reason for which Plans are disabled.

post.description: This API collects all the details of the customer for the payment.

service_amount.description: Total amount to be financed. Financed amount + Downpayment amount will be used as total service amount if customer chooses to pay now.

downpayment_amount.description: This amount will be taken as downpayment if customer makes a contract. Financed amount + Downpayment amount will be used as total service amount if customer chooses to pay now.

number_of_payments.description: Total number of payments option to be provided to customer for a contract.

start_date.description: First payment will be deducted on this date if customer makes a contract. Format should be "YYYY-MM-DD". Should be a future date.

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth of the customer. Format should be "YYYY-MM-DD".

service_array.description: This is an array which requires the details of the service provided with the price. This field will be required soon.

post.summary: Provide customer details for the Payment

full_amount_disabled_reason.description: Reason for which Payment Processor has been disabled.

post.description: This API collects all the details of the customer for the payment.

service_amount.description: Total amount to be financed. Financed amount + Downpayment amount will be used as total service amount if customer chooses to pay now.

service_array.description: This is an array which requires the details of the service provided with the price. This field will be required soon.

post.summary: Provide customer details for the Contract

total.description: Total payable amount every month (Without Late Fees)

plan_disabled_reason.description: Reason for which Plans are disabled.

post.description: This API collects all the details of the customer for the contract.

service_amount.description: Total amount to be financed. Financed amount + Downpayment amount will be used as total service amount if customer chooses to pay now.

downpayment_amount.description: This amount will be taken as downpayment if customer makes a contract. Financed amount + Downpayment amount will be used as total service amount if customer chooses to pay now.

number_of_payments.description: Total number of payments option to be provided to customer for a contract.

start_date.description: First payment will be deducted on this date if customer makes a contract. Format should be "YYYY-MM-DD". Should be a future date.

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth of the customer. Format should be "YYYY-MM-DD".

service_array.description: This is an array which requires the details of the service provided with the price. This field will be required soon.
